description: Straightforward office visit — established patient with hypertension
source_note: 65yo M presents for follow-up of hypertension. BP today 142/88. On lisinopril 20mg daily. No chest pain, no shortness of breath. Lungs clear. Heart regular rate and rhythm. Assessment: Essential hypertension, not at goal. Plan: Increase lisinopril to 40mg daily, recheck BP in 4 weeks, basic metabolic panel.

description: New patient with type 2 diabetes and peripheral neuropathy
source_note: 52yo F new patient with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes, HbA1c 9.2%. Complains of bilateral foot numbness and tingling x 3 months. PMH: obesity BMI 34. Exam: decreased sensation bilateral feet to monofilament. Assessment: Type 2 diabetes mellitus with diabetic polyneuropathy, obesity. Plan: Start metformin 500mg BID, refer endocrinology, diabetic shoe fitting, HbA1c recheck 3 months.
expected_diagnoses: type 2 diabetes mellitus with diabetic polyneuropathy

description: Coding specificity issue — unspecified knee pain missing laterality
source_note: 45yo M with knee pain for 2 weeks after twisting injury playing basketball. Exam shows medial joint line tenderness, positive McMurray test. X-ray negative for fracture. Assessment: Internal derangement of knee. Plan: MRI knee, physical therapy referral, naproxen 500mg BID.

description: Complex multi-diagnosis encounter with compliance risk
source_note: 78yo F presents with acute exacerbation of COPD with productive cough and increased dyspnea x 3 days. Also managing chronic low back pain. PMH: COPD, lumbar stenosis, former smoker. Vitals: SpO2 91% on RA, RR 24, temp 100.1F. Lungs: bilateral wheezes and rhonchi. Assessment: 1) Acute exacerbation of COPD 2) Chronic low back pain, stable 3) Possible pneumonia vs bronchitis. Plan: Chest X-ray, prednisone burst 40mg x 5 days, albuterol nebulizer, azithromycin, follow-up 1 week.
expected_documentation_gaps: possible pneumonia not confirmed with imaging

description: Prior authorization scenario — total knee arthroplasty
source_note: 68yo M with severe right knee osteoarthritis. Failed 6 months of conservative management including physical therapy, NSAIDs, and cortisone injection. Weight-bearing X-ray shows bone-on-bone medial compartment. BMI 28. Cleared by cardiology for surgery. Assessment: Primary osteoarthritis right knee, severe. Plan: Schedule total knee arthroplasty, obtain prior authorization from UnitedHealthcare.
